items.name: Evaluating Audit Results
items.short_description:
While identifying risk and performing audit procedures are important parts of an audit, evaluating the results of those procedures are just as important. If audit results aren’t evaluated, then an audit opinion cannot be issued! This CPE course on evaluating audit evidence gives you the knowledge you need to know what it takes to evaluate audit results in a financial statement audit. It's a complex topic under both. U.S. GAAS and PCAOB auditing standards, because the requirements are governed by various auditing standards. This course includes a discussion of the following PCAOB and U.S. GAAS standards:

1. AS 2810, Evaluating Audit Results
2. AS 1215, Audit Documentation
3. AU-C Section 330, Performing Audit Procedures in Response to Assessed Risks and Evaluating the Audit Evidence Obtained
4. AU-C Section 450, Evaluation of Misstatements Identified during the Audit

The guidance required by both the PCAOB, and the AICPA is primarily the same as it relates to the various topics discussed in this course. If there are any significant differences between the two sets of standards, the course differentiates between the two.

It's important for an auditor to consider all audit evidence obtained and whether it’s sufficient and appropriate to support the audit opinion. It’s also important to know how to handle any identified misstatements discovered in your audit procedures, and the extent of required documentation. This evaluating audit evidence CPE course includes these topics and more! 

This evaluating audit results CPE eLearning course (1.0 CPE) discusses what an auditor must perform and consider when evaluating the results of an audit, including important information on misstatements, audit evidence and documentation. It is easy to understand and full of examples. Therefore, it is truly a must for any auditor!

items.name: SEC Reporting: Non-GAAP Financial Measures
items.short_description: Over 90% of companies use non-GAAP financial measures in SEC filings, earnings releases, and other public disclosures to better “tell their story.” However, if they decide to present such measures, they better make sure they don’t run afoul of SEC reporting requirements. And judging by the fact that non-GAAP financial measures has been the number one area of SEC comment letters over the past several years, it seems most could use a refresher of the rules! Take a journey with us to the Upside Down with this Stranger Things-inspired CPE-eligible eLearning course (1.5 CPE) covering everything you need to know about non-GAAP financial measures. The self-study course begins by defining non-GAAP financial measures, giving common examples used by companies, and explaining why companies use them. We’ll then walk through the applicable SEC guidance and requirements set out in Regulation G and Item 10(e) of Regulation S-K. Next, you’ll learn about the most common types of SEC staff comments related to non-GAAP financial measures and the focus of their Compliance and Disclosure Interpretations (C&DIs). The course concludes with looking at "real-life" example filings and the related SEC comment letters. Some people believe that non-GAAP financial measures provide investors with valuable insight, while others believe it helps companies paint a "rosier picture" than what is reality. Regardless of which side of the fence you are on with respect to non-GAAP financial measures, this eLearning course will help you understand the requirements and ensure that you don't draw the ire of the SEC!

items.name: Financial Instruments: Hedge Accounting
items.short_description:
Entities are exposed to many risks, but they can often mitigate their financial risks using financial instruments called derivatives. Such risks include interest rate risk, foreign currency risk, and price (or market) risk. But there's one small catch! Derivative instruments can create volatility in earnings because these instruments are normally recorded at fair value with changes in fair value recorded through profit or loss in accordance with IFRS 9. However, the underlying hedged item is accounted for using other standards which creates an accounting mismatch. Enter hedge accounting! Upon meeting strict criteria, hedge accounting may be used to reduce this income statement volatility. So why doesn't everyone do it? Because it's complex! This CPE-eligible, eLearning course (1.5 CPE) walks through hedge accounting under IFRS 9 in a way that is easily understood.



IFRS 9 covers a variety of topics on accounting for financial instruments including classification and measurement, impairment, derivatives, hedging, and derecognition. This course will focus on hedge accounting.

items.name: Change Management for Strategic Initiatives
items.short_description:
Learn to utilize effective change management to deliver project results.

This Bigger Brain course will equip you to lead through change. Susan Stocker is certified in change acceleration process and has been the change leader in major business transformations. She will explain how you can proactively plan for change, engage people in change, and monitor progress throughout the transition.

A strong understanding of change management is vital to help ensure a business initiative is successful. Susan will describe the Change Acceleration Process (CAP) and provide an in-depth explanation of each of its 5 stages. You'll learn about the CAP Toolkit which provides essential tools for bringing the collective ideas of the CAP team together and for shaping the CAP plan deliverables.
You'll learn how to get leaders prepared to actively support the change and to role model change behaviors, how to craft a vision statement, and how to use the elevator speech model to communicate your vision statement. You'll also learn how to mobilize commitment through both Stakeholder Analysis and Technical/Political/Cultural Analysis.
A clear understanding of both the process and the tools in the CAP toolkit can enable you to lead confidently and effectively through change.

items.name: Drafting a Compelling Presentation
items.short_description:
Learn how to create good first drafts for your business presentations.

Do you give business presentations as part of your job? If so, you know a good presentation starts with a good first draft. Creating that first draft is where a lot of people struggle. In this Bigger Brains course, we'll share a technique for getting your first draft out of your head and onto a document quickly. Subject matter expert Susan Stocker will show you an effective mapping technique for developing your key messages and supporting content.

You'll learn how the Presentation Diagram works, how to use it to draft your key messages, and how to tailor your presentation to your audience and your time frame. You'll also learn best practices for using the presentation template. By the end of this course, you'll have the information you need to use this tool to save time when drafting your own presentations and for when you need to draft a presentation for another presenter or with a team.â€¯

items.name: Giving Feedback
items.short_description: Learn to give feedback efficiently and effectively to change and improve performance. Valuable feedback is crucial for employee development and organizational success. In this Bigger Brains course, subject matter expert Susan Stocker will discuss what constitutes good feedback, the skills needed to provide effective feedback, and strategies for responding to resistance to feedback. She'll explain your role in creating a constructive feedback environment and how you can prepare your team to view feedback in a positive way. You'll learn how to distinguish between feedback, coaching, and performance management, how to determine the frequency and formality of giving feedback, and how to use a Feedback Model to prepare and deliver more effective feedback. You'll also learn how to avoid giving ineffective feedback and see demonstrations of the SBI Feedback Model in action. If your job entails regularly communicating information to an employee about their performance, work results, skills, or other aspects of their daily tasks, this course is for you!

items.name: Root Cause Problem Solving
items.short_description:
Learn how utilizing a structured framework will empower you to identify and solve problems for long-term organizational improvement.

This course provides an explanation of and step-by-step approach for working through the specific phases of the problem-solving process. You'll see how to use the root cause diagram, a visual framework for identifying the true source(s) of the problem. You'll learn how to determine which root causes should be addressed first and how to plan for creating and implementing sustainable solutions.

Without finding a root cause, we can waste time and resources implementing a solution that may not actually fix our problem or only fix it partially. In Root Cause Problem Solving, you'll learn how to spend your time on the right things in order to fix the right problem.

items.name: Viva Overview
items.short_description:

**Tim Blake, a Microsoft certified trainer, **will demonstrate Microsoft Viva's features. He'll describe the key elements of Viva, showing you how to locate each one, and explaining how they interact within the Microsoft ecosystem.

You'll learn the benefits and uses of Viva for your organization. You'll explore the Viva apps intended for communication purposes, Viva Connections, Viva, Engage, and Viva Amplify, and consider the features and uses of each.

You'll see how Glint integrates with Insights and Pulse, enabling you to bridge the gap between feedback and impact and thus drive strategic actions that strengthen your organization. 
 
Viva can also help you boost your skills and career. You'll see how to find and access training content in Viva Learning. You'll also learn how the Viva Learning Management System allows you to integrate with Microsoft Teams, connect to other LMSs, and share videos with others!

items.name: AI Fluency - Data Privacy
items.short_description:

Generative AI tools are revolutionizing the way we work. To use them effectively, we must be diligent in keeping sensitive information protected. In this Bigger Brains course, we outline how large language models work, explore how Generative AI tools use our data, discuss where that data may come from, and highlight the data privacy risks that should be considered.

You will learn specific ways to protect your data as well as your customer's data. You'll also learn how to evaluate privacy policies to help determine which AI tools are safe to trust and which might misuse your data.

items.name: AI Fluency - Intro to Prompts
items.short_description:

items.name: Brain Bites - Ergonomics Unleashed (Spanish)
items.short_description:
Aprende cómo los principios de la ergonomía pueden mejorar y enriquecer tu experiencia laboral.

¿Experimentas molestias o fatiga al trabajar en tu escritorio? ¿Quieres mejorar tu postura y crear un espacio de trabajo más cómodo y productivo? items.name: Excel for Project Management
items.short_description:
Manage a project from creating the Project Charter during the Initiation phase through task management and stakeholder communication all the way to Closeout--all within Excel.

Many tools can be used for Project Management, but Excel has the power to cover your Project Management needs. Instead of learning new software, leverage the power of Excel to create the deliverables of a Project Management Plan, including the Project Charter, Requirements, Issues Log, Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), Risk Register, and Stakeholder Communication. When all the information about your project is compiled in one workbook, you can answer any question about your project.

In this course, Microsoft Certified Trainer and PMP Christina Tankersley walks you through creating each deliverable and customizing it to the needs of your project. Using multiple Excel worksheets, you will always know where to track a new piece of information. A new requirement identified? Add it to your Requirements sheet. A new stakeholder? Add them to your Stakeholder Communication sheet. Without any additional project management tools, you can track all the information you need, and use Excel features such as linked fields and conditional formatting to create a professional and effective Project Management Plan.

items.name: Managing Conflict: Interpersonal Conflict
items.short_description:
Learn skills for successful conflict intervention and de-escalation.

Conflict is a natural part of human interaction, and the way we handle it can significantly impact our relationships. Dr. Kevin Jones, an expert in conflict management, mediation, and de-escalation with over 20 years' experience providing training in the field, will explain and demonstrate how to successfully manage interpersonal conflict.

You'll learn how to identify types and sources of conflict, how third-party influences and miscommunication affect conflict, steps for engaging with interpersonal conflict, and the role of empathy in conflict minimization.

You'll also learn key communication skills important for conflict management including distinguishing between responding and reacting, avoiding miscommunication, how to ask questions for clarity regarding different perspectives, and four steps to communicate your own needs and interests.

By the end of this course, you'll have the tools you need to plan and prepare for a functional conflict process that leads to positive outcomes.

items.name: Managing Conflict: Managing Self
items.short_description:
Learn how to prepare yourself first in order to better manage conflict in the workplace.

Conflict in the workplace can be uncomfortable. It can have a negative effect on both morale and productivity and individual responses to conflict vary from person to person. In this course you'll learn how to identify conflict triggers and how external influences affect one's perception of conflict.

You'll learn the five conflict modes and how to determine which approach to use in different scenarios. You'll also learn to identify your default approach to conflict.

In addition, you'll learn specific techniques to prepare the mind and body for responding to conflict and how to increase awareness of how one's own mental attitude, words, and language can either increase or diffuse conflict.

items.name: Managing Conflict: Team and Group Dynamics
items.short_description:
Learn skills for successful conflict intervention and de-escalation in your teams.

Conflict is a natural part of human interaction, and the way we handle it can significantly impact our relationships. Dr. Kevin Jones, an expert in conflict management, mediation, and de-escalation with over 20 years' experience providing training in the field, will explain and demonstrate how to successfully manage conflicts specifically related to team dynamics and among multiple people in a team environment.

Kevin will show you how to distinguish between team and interpersonal conflict and describe the difference between functional and dysfunctional conflict. He will also discuss ways you can prevent future conflicts.

You'll learn the elements that are essential to the conflict resolution process, the role of team leaders throughout the conflict process, and the role of peers in conflict situations and resolution. You'll also learn what steps to take in the conflict management process and the steps for promoting resolution.

By the end of this course, you'll have the tools you need to successfully manage conflict intervention and de-escalation within teams.

attributes.label: Product Name
attributes.option_value: managing conflict: team and group dynamics

items.name: Brain Bites - Microsoft Teams Meetings (2025)
items.short_description:
Maximize your meetings with Microsoft Teams

If someone said you'd learn in less than 30 minutes how to easily meet virtually and collaborate using Teams, would you believe them? Believe it! Bigger Brains can teach you how to join a Teams meeting, use the controls available and present flawlessly.

Thanks to its features and ease of use, Microsoft Teams is quickly becoming the dominant meeting platform for businesses of all sizes. Don't be left behind! We'll take a look at the major features of Teams meetings, including its deep integration with Microsoft Outlook and collaboration tools like Microsoft Whiteboard and PowerPoint.

items.name: Ethics for Managers
items.short_description:
Understanding and implementing business ethics is crucial for
creating a successful, sustainable organization. This course
explores how ethical business practices shape the production,
distribution, and delivery of goods and services. You'll learn
how to build trust, maintain integrity, and develop transparency
in your business dealings while fostering a culture of ethical
decision-making.

items.name: Ethics for Everyone
items.short_description:
Accountability, honesty, respect, and compliance can help you
create a trustworthy and efficient workplace. This course takes
you through the essential principles of ethical behavior and
provides practical strategies to implement them in your daily
work life. Learn how to build lasting trust, create an inclusive
environment, ensure equitable treatment, and develop a reputation
for integrity that will serve you throughout your career.

items.name: Learning Styles: 01. The Brain's Function
items.short_description:
Learning is your brain’s most powerful skill, and this course
is all about how it happens, from the parts of the brain
involved to learning styles and applications. By learning
how your brain works, you can pick up skills to enhance
your personal and professional growth.

items.name: Learning Styles: 02. Exploring the Seven Styles
items.short_description:
Understanding the seven different learning styles and how
they impact the way you absorb and process information
can help you become a lifelong learner. You can enhance
your personal learning strategies and improve collaboration
with others. This course provides valuable insights to help
you thrive in any learning environment.

attributes.label: Product Name
attributes.option_value: learning styles: 02. exploring the seven styles

items.name: Learning Styles: 03. Developing Your Style
items.short_description: This course is designed to help you discover how to absorb and retain information in ways that work best for you—whether through visuals, sound, hands-on activities, or reflection. You’ll explore practical strategies to combine learning methods for longer lasting and more durable results.

items.name: Learning Styles: 04. Managing Different Styles
items.short_description:
In today's diverse workplace, understanding and managing
different learning styles is crucial for effective training and
development. This course explores how to identify and
accommodate various learning styles to enhance employee
engagement and productivity. By tailoring training strategies
to meet your team’s needs you can create a dynamic
and inclusive learning environment.

items.name: Problem Solving: 01. Defining the Problem
items.short_description:
In this course, you'll start your problem-solving journey by learning
to diagnose issues effectively, gather and analyze data, and
understand the root causes of challenges. Whether you're a leader
guiding a team or tackling problems independently, this course
equips you with the skills to approach problems with clarity and
purpose. By the end, you'll be prepared to implement thoughtful,
data-driven solutions that address the core of any issue.

items.name: Problem Solving: 02. Finding the Root Cause
items.short_description: Enhance your problem-solving skills by mastering the art of finding the root cause of issues. This course delves into the second step of the problem-solving process, teaching you how to uncover the under-lying factors contributing to challenges. You'll learn to use effective tools and strategies, such as the "5 Whys" and cause-and-effect diagrams, to identify root causes. By the end of this course, you'll be equipped to address problems at their source, leading to more sustainable and impactful solutions.

attributes.label: Product Name
attributes.option_value: problem solving: 02. finding the root cause

items.name: Problem Solving: 03. Generating Solutions
items.short_description:
Generating effective solutions is an essential element of problem
solving. This course guides you through the crucial step of
brainstorming and evaluating potential solutions to address
identified problems. You'll learn to use creative techniques and
tools, such as questioning and the SCAMPER method, to explore a
wide range of possibilities. By the end of this course, you'll be
equipped to generate innovative, targeted solutions that align
with your organization's goals and drive impactful results.

items.name: Problem Solving: 04. Evaluating Solutions
items.short_description:
Develop your problem-solving skills by learning how to evaluate
and select the best solutions. This course guides you through
the critical step of assessing potential solutions to address
identified problems. You'll learn to use effective tools and strategies,
such as SWOT analysis and affinity diagramming, to make
informed decisions. By the end of this course, you'll be equipped
to choose the most viable solutions that align with your organization's
goals and resources.

items.name: Problem Solving: 05. Implementing the Solution
items.short_description:
This course guides you through the crucial steps of action
planning and execution to address problems you’ve identified.
You'll learn to create detailed action plans, allocate resources, and
communicate effectively to ensure successful implementation. By
the end of this course, you'll be equipped to turn your solutions into
reality, driving impactful results for your organization.

items.name: Problem Solving: 06. Monitoring the Solution
items.short_description:
Develop your problem-solving skills by learning how to
effectively monitor solutions. This course guides you through
the crucial step of tracking and evaluating the success of
implemented solutions. You'll learn to use various tools and
techniques to ensure that your solutions are effective and
sustainable. By the end of this course, you'll be equipped to
continuously improve processes and prevent recurring issues,
driving long-term success for your organization.
